I love the game, it very realistic and has great features.there are some things I would like for you guys to add if you can. Do you think you could add these airplanes?. a B-25 Mitchell, b-24 liberator, B-17G and SBD Dauntless. Also I would like for there to be more campaigns like a Tuskegee campaign where you have to protect b-17s and get them to their target. Now for the review of the controls, features, graphics, and planes. One I would like if you didn‚Äôt have to pay for the customizations for the planes like the paint and weapons. The graphics are great not gonna lie but do you think you could make the cockpits different from each other instead of every plane having the same cockpit. Thanks for reading this review.

I truly enjoy the way the game plays on my tablet, but there are a few issues. There should be a bail out button. Having to shake my tablet just seems weird and unrealistic. I wish I could watch enemy aircraft when I am in pursuit. All I see is the red or yellow arrow and I never know if they are maneuvering away or onto my tail until I see bullet holes in my windshield, and I want to play campaign mode on one side. Personally, I don‚Äôt wish to fight for Japan or Germany and shoot down Americans. Just not my thing. Other than that, great game.

The P-51 is pathetic next to the P-47 in this game , which is absurd . The armaments don‚Äôt match up with the planes , and there are other aircraft that have way higher offensive/ defensive abilities that aren‚Äôt even close to what they had IRL . That being said , it‚Äôs a lot of fun ; one of the most entertaining WW II flying games out there . It‚Äôs too bad that the developers never added anything to it , and went into Sky Gamblers 2 . The P-47 is God like compared to all other available aircraft for some reason , and of course you have to buy it if you want it . Multiplayer is awful because of this . Guys who buy this plane are unstoppable , no matter how good you are . They paid , and you‚Äôre unable to compete with them unless you buy one as well . It‚Äôs at it‚Äôs best in single player .

title.label: WHY ARE BUTTONS SO SMALL NOW?

content.label: I used to play this a couple years ago and buttons were bigger. Normally not a problem, but the control surface is exactly the button. The Rudder (yaw L&R ) is so close to edge of screen, and half the time doesn't work. Before you could use Machine gun and Cannon together, but now I have to make sure I have corner of the tip of my thumb right on it. Idk, other games have option of adjusting size and location of buttons, and since this game is about the only decent Air Combat, since another game is gonna disappear soon, help your fat fingered pilots out, FFS.

The game is certainly a good game. The gaming community is active. However there are two problems in the game. 1. Ace airplanes(the ones that you need to buy with money) are too strong and it broke the balance when play in multiple players. For example, P-47 this plane‚Äôs structure are too high that it take about 2times of the damage that a regular plane do. This had become a big problem because players who have this plane likes the play head to head tactic(when two air planes fly towards each other and shooting each other, an exchange of hp), when play this tactic it is guaranteed that the P-47 will win, which is breaking the balance. And when one player play this tactic to another player, the other player must play the same thing otherwise his tail will be bait on by the P-47. As a result of this, player that have P-47 will easily win. In conclusion, the Ace airplanes are over powered they need to be weakened to balance the game. 2. I cannot find a place in the game to report another player. This problem is not only in StormRaiders but also in all other game made by sky gamblers. As a result of this, when play in multiplayer you may curse all you want and there will have no penalty given.
